intro: Lysimachia capitata, commonly known as the yellow archangel, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, bright yellow flowers in dense, spike-like clusters at the top of the stems, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Lysimachia capitata thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. It is also known for its medicinal uses in traditional herbal remedies.
